channel.title: Changes to the tutorial board
channel.description:
We have decided to split and expand the tutorial board into two new child boards: Featured Tutorials and Snippets.
'Featured Tutorials' will contain only the best of the best tutorials, as determined by the staff. The criteria for this system is intended to be private and arbitrary. We cannot generally judge tutorials, so the criteria used will be dependent on the staff member deciding whether a tutorial is adequate to be in 'featured' or not (similar to how awards are given out).
The 'Snippets' board will contain any thoroughly unexplained "tutorials" or just general code fragments.
The regular tutorials board will now have an increasingly tighter leash (but not too tight!) on quality control. We now have a board to throw poor tutorials in and another to throw outstanding tutorials in. I encourage each and every one of you tutorial writers to strive to write quality tutorials to make it into that featured board.
Thanks much!
MoparScape Staff

item.title: Changes to the tutorial board
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I also like this idea, it should stop everyone being all like “SNIPPET TOPIC NAO” on every second post that enters the board.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to the tutorial board
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I like it

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to the tutorial board
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:11, topic:453622”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=556457.msg4073533#msg4073533 date=1344574452]

I approve as well. Will client tutorials be going into this type of relation as well or what? Will client tutorials have similar treatment?

No, the client section hasn’t proved its activity enough to me quite yet. I’m keeping it all integrated in the hacking board for now.
[/quote]do you mean activity wise, or just no really worthy tutorials in the section?[/quote]

Activity wise. The tutorials that show up once in a while are fine. But when you consider the amount of topics in that board and the fact that it’s a combination of many boards at once, it’s not really worth going through them all to separate it into separate sections. I’ve received a lot of suggestions to do this and the only way I would is if I was in a fantastic mood after all these months of changes are done.

Read full topic
